snippet: The banking official quit and three subordinates were fired after an electronic theft from Bangladesh’s account at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.
abstract: Atiur Rahman, governor of Bangladesh central bank, resigns amid scandal over hacker theft of $81 million from Bangladesh’s official account at Federal Reserve Bank of New York; Rahman faced mounting pressure to explain how he had been unaware of theft, which was reported by Philippines news outlets and apparently carried out using official bank technology.
lead_paragraph: The banking official quit and three subordinates were fired after an electronic theft from Bangladesh’s account at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

headline.main: Bangladesh Bank Chief Resigns After Cyber Theft of $81 Million
headline.print_headline: In Bangladesh, Official Quits After Theft of $81 Million

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
